meanings.sent1: The stormy weather made for an unfavorable day at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The team faced unfavorable odds in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: It was quite unfavorable when the ice cream shop ran out of chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's stern look gave an unfavorable start to the class.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds painted an unfavorable picture for the picnic.

meanings.sent1: The movie received unfavorable reviews from the critics.
meanings.sent2: The taste of the medicine was quite unfavorable to the child.
meanings.sent3: It was unfavorable to find a spider in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The smell coming from the kitchen was unfavorable to the guests.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise was unfavorable to the peaceful atmosphere of the library.

meanings.definition: Showing disapproval or lack of support.
meanings.sent1: Her unfavorable reaction to the idea was evident on her face.
meanings.sent2: The politician received unfavorable feedback from the public.
meanings.sent3: It was unfavorable when the cat knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The principal's stern gaze was unfavorable towards the misbehaving students.
meanings.sent5: The lack of applause was unfavorable to the performer's ego.
